thread.title: FBI, Justice Department Launch Inquiry into Fantasy Sports Websites
thread.title_full: FBI, Justice Department Launch Inquiry into Fantasy Sports Websites

author: Jeanette Torres
title: FBI, Justice Department Launch Inquiry into Fantasy Sports Websites
text:
Share Article 
Photodisc/Thinkstock (WASHINGTON) -- The booming daily fantasy sports business is facing yet another legal hurdle.The FBI and the Justice Department have launched an inquiry into the practices of these billion dollar websites after last week's revelation that an employee of Draft Kings won $350,000 on a rival site, Fan Duel, and may have shared inside information.Officials want to know if the games are a form of online gambling or something else. If DraftKings and FanDuel are found to be more luck than skill, then banks would be prohibited from handling transactions between the sites and the players.Watch a report from ABC News' Good Morning America below to learn more about the investigation:
